name: Nisqually Lodge

reviews.text: Location very convenient and room was clean and quiet. We found the staff friendly and equally enjoyed conversations with other guests from around the world! I would only suggest to separate the drinks from other continental breakfast items so more than 2 people may make their breakfast at the same time. An nice addition would be instant oatmeal? Best for us was it was one of few area lodgings that offered 1 nite only lodging. We would definately return.
reviews.title: Family bonding with nature

reviews.text: Reading some of the reviews of this establishment prior to staying here made me a bit anxious regarding the disposition of the proprietors. However I found the staff to be very accommodating and any questions I had were answered with a friendly attitude and helpful advice. The lodge itself is very clean with large rooms that were very comfortable. The free continental breakfast is basic but more than adequate for me. For those who are considering this lodge for their visit to Mt. Rainier, be advised that it is about 6 miles from the entrance to the Park and from the entrance it is a further 18 miles (40 minute drive) to the Paradise area of the Park. I had no problem going back and forth but forewarned is forearmed!
reviews.title: Very satisfied!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While there were no frills, it was a nice, large, super-clean room. Comfy bed and invigorating shower...no wimpy showerhead! A word of advice, we stopped for dinner at the Wild Berry restaurant down the road...don't go. Their $14 "fish & chips" dinner was frozen french fies and Mrs. Pauls breaded fish patties.
reviews.title: Super-Clean and Spacious

reviews.text: I had the best stay at this lodge. the people at the desk were very helpful, pleasant, and had a great since of humor. the staff was also very pleasant. coffee was full, breakfast items were well stocked and eminities were great. my stay there was very pleasant. Anyone who wants tv, air conditioning and clean rooms with great eating establishments close by should definately try this lodge as it made my trip very much enjoyable..thank you nisqually lodge for all the information on the surrounding area, your help, and friendly service..karen
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We turned up at the Nisqually Lodge on spec as we wanted to stay in the Mount Rainier area. The location is great, only about 6 miles from the park entrance, and as we had a room at the back of the lodge it didn't really matter that it is on the main road.
reviews.title: Great rooms but poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had decided to wing our accommodations on one of the nights we were in the Mt. Rainier area. Driving down the road, we discovered that our choices were more limited than we had thought. Initially, we checked out Whittaker's Bunkhouse, where we realized there was no TV. Bringing this to the attention of the very nice innkeeper, she suggested that we check out Nisqually Lodge if we really needed a TV- we did. Sure, we're suppose to be enjoying nature and all that, but heck, we're attached to our creature comforts.
reviews.title: Big Clean Rooms, Quiet, has TV and AC! Unfriendly hosts

reviews.text: The innkeepers here are not friendly at all. If anything, they act like they are they doing you a HUGE favor by renting you a room. They gave us a really weird look when we asked to see the room beforehand and just waved us upstairs, saying the empty rooms were open. When we checked out, the woman seemed much friendlier and wished us a nice day- probably because she was glad we were leaving!
reviews.title: Good value, huge rooms with AC!

reviews.text: HOWEVER, these rooms are quite nice, a great value for the price, and make up for the surly service. There is TV with a decent number of channels to watch, AC, a nice clean bathroom, and best of all, it was quiet. We never heard anyone else! And we knew there were others based on the cars parked outside.
reviews.title: Good value for the price , friendly staff, close to Mt. Rainier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a previous reviewer stated- you have to compare this to what else you can find in the area and this place is definitely way better than the others.
reviews.title: Nice place, but NOISY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed two nights at Nisqually one before my Rainier climb and one after. I had planned to camp out but Seattle and the surrounding area were suffering a heat wave. It was 104 when I got off the plane!
reviews.title: A step above the average motel

reviews.text: I stayed at Nisqually last night and thought it was a decent place in a very convenient location. Nothing special but also nothing bad. Rooms were spacious and quite clean. You will have to carry your bags upstairs, if you have a room there.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place in Great Location

reviews.text: I had to chuckle at the first review and the warning to "avoid at all costs" and also that the front desk clerk was rude and in the wrong business! I have stayed at enough mountain hotels to know that these places are NOT the Marriott and customer service is not their forte. These small local businesses know they have a captive audience-you go there for Mt. Rainier and to hike and bike and enjoy the natural beauty of the country (and trust me there is plenty of astounding beauty here to make up for any rude clerk at Nisqually Lodge!) and not for the ammenities.
reviews.title: Basic room, free WiFi, Less than stellar Hosts, and plenty of Natural Beauty of the Mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is basic, old and somewhat tired, and yes, the mom and pop who run this place were not raised in the south and are to the point to say the least. The rooms are adequate but they do have free wireless and TV. The lobby does have microwave and horrible coffee and breakfast in am. I chose to go one mile down the road to the internet cafe where gourmet coffee is available, and a bit further down the road to the wonderful Copper Creek Cafe for their out of this world breakfasts and homemade breads.
reviews.title: Avoid at all cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been going to Mt. Rainier to hike and backpack for 10 years and this was the 1st time I stayed at Nisqually Inn. I would stay there again if I needed to just because of the convenience to the mountain.
reviews.title: Clean nice lodge

likes.disliked: — only one place to eat close by

reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay. Even with a written and phone confirmation, I was treated like I was not at all welcome. The woman at the front desk (owner?) was rude, unhelpful, mean (to me as well as her employees), and in the wrong business. She claimed she would not honor my rate even though I had confirmed it many times. What are you to do when you arrive late at night with no other options? Also, the place had handwritten signs all over saying don't do this or that. What an unwelcome place!!
reviews.title: Nice Spot

likes.disliked: — No microwave or fridge in room

reviews.text: We found this place and were so glad we did! We are budget travelers, so this place felt really "nice" to us and the price was the same as we were paying at our haunts. Our room was large and comfy and the view was nice--something we normally never have. The rooms were clean. The temperature was even--not too hot and not too cold. We fought with heating units all over Washington--either we froze or we fried. It was a relief not to have to fuss with this. Extra blankets were in the room--how nice!!! Great value and great location to see Mount Rainier from. And the lobby had magazines and books to peruse. Breakfast was just fine--even danish. It had a lot of charm and ambiance.
reviews.title: My family loved this place!

reviews.text: Adequate for our needs! The staff is very helpful and friendly even with difficult customers as they had 2 night that were being extra obnoxious and very over the top in their needs. We were sitting in the lobby enjoying the fireplace and enjoying some rest and relaxation and one was complaining of noise! What noise we're not sure as we hadn't heard anything and nobody else was complaining. The other was complaining because the one and only DVD player was already in use and by another guest and this guest was especially rude about that. Couldn't believe there was only one dvd player for 24 rooms!!! I have stayed in hotels/motels where there wasn't any dvd player!
reviews.title: Great no frills place close to everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is basic--nothing fancy and nothing special! But its so close to restaurants that food wasn't an issue. There is a restaurant across the parking lot but that one is awful! Really bad food! Choose the Highlander or the Cooper Creek which are about a mile either side of the lodge. Gallerys are close as well as park entrance. All in all its a wonderful place to stay and very cheap in the off season!
reviews.title: Basic room, uncomfortable beds but clean

reviews.text: This place looks nice enough. It's clean. But the bed was very uncomfortable. Others have commented about the staff -- and I witnessed an interesting interaction as the people in front of me were checking in. They were given two rooms on ground floor next to the soda/ice machine. When they expressed concern about the noise, the person at the desk said it wouldn't be a problem and said no other rooms were available. However, that wasn't true because our room was on the second floor and many doors to empty rooms were open. As others have said, Ashland doesn't have much -- which is surprising considering it's location just outside the park . We had dinner at The Copper Creek Inn and it was good.
reviews.title: Cozy Little Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to climbing Rainier - cute little motel! Room itself was basic, a little dated but completely adequate & clean. Our room opened out onto a little balcony with a sitting area and a view of the trees. The downside to this is that it gets a bit noisy if other folks are out enjoying their balconies with some brews too :) Didn't bug me but others might feel differently.
reviews.title: Pleasant Choice

description: 24 unit cozy hotel located minutes Mount Rainier National Park. We offer free Wi-Fi, flat screen tvs, free HOT continental breakfast and much more! King suites and conference room available. Small pets welcome.
